body:
Gregory J. Ward wrote: 


> P.S.  Regarding Thomas' comments *.exr is the OpenEXR format, and  
> *.hdr is usually interpreted as Radiance format under OS X.  The  
> latest mouse from Apple is 3-button, and there is generally good  
> support for third-party three-button mice.  The one-button mouse  
> works using the control- and option- keys, but it's a pain that way.   
> There is a good set of OS X books available from O'Reilly, which may  
> even be found as free PDFs online.  My favorite is "Mac OS X for Unix  
> Geeks," which I found on the web somewhere.  I have the hardcopy as  
> well, but I can't seem to locate the link at the moment -- maybe it  
> was a fluke.


I have O'Reilly's "Using SAMBA" as a pdf, can't remember where I got 
that either, but felt like I was getting away with something when I 
downloaded it.  I think it's a fluke, Greg. "Mac OS X for Unix  Geeks" 
is a good book, as are most of the O'Reilly catalog items.


- Rob
